Question: What was the most accomplished work by the American author Dreiser?

Question: What script is used to write the body of the Japanese literary work The Chronicle of Ancient Matters?
Source Sentence (en): The text is mainly in variant Chinese script, with one-character-one-syllable notation used for archaic words and proper nouns that are difficult to substitute for the Chinese text. All songs are written in one-character-one-ton notation, including the one-character-one-ton notation portion of the text, and are the subject of research in the Jōdai Tokushu Kana-yo [Note 3]. In the one-character-one-syllable notation, some of the names of deities are written with the characters "上" and "去" at the right side, which are the same as "上" and "去" among the four tones of the Chinese language found in Chinese documents [14].
